recommendations.body: **Masks** are now recommended for vaccinated individuals in public indoor spaces to reduce the spread of the Omicron variant. Unvaccinated people should continue to mask in all public spaces. [See guidance on masks](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/fully-vaccinated.html).

**Booster shots** [offer necessary protection](https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#covidnet-hospitalizations-vaccination) against infection, serious illness and death from all COVID variants, and are [90% effective at preventing hospitalization](https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/71/wr/mm7104e3.htm?s_cid=mm7104e3_x) from Omicron.
**Vaccinations** for children 5 and up can protect against infection, serious illness and death from COVID.
**Testing frequently** is important for reducing spread. Rapid testing prior to in-person gatherings can help reduce risk of infection and protect vulnerable individuals.
